aid, when I give alternate ideas.=C2=A0 Maybe professional jealously?

ending yourself ?????Rick

On Sun, Aug 22, 2010 at 4:16 PM, Rj <rasterer@...> wro=
te:


=C2=A0 







I realize you have plenty of subjective anecdotal evid=
ence.I don't consider that 'hard evidence' however.=C2=A0 I am looking for =
something a little more objective and less subject to influence and interpr=
etations.

And stop putting words in my mouth. A person can misinterpret so=
mething, mistake something, or confuse something, without lying about somet=
hing.=C2=A0 And before you jump down my throat claiming I am saying all res=
ults are mistakes, I am not.=C2=A0 I am performing experiments, keeping an =
open mind, and considering all evidence I find. 

The way you have been att=
acking me by calling me names at every turn, just because I try new things =
and don't always agree with your world view, is eerily reminiscent of the w=
ay the church of old tried to suppress new thought and discoveries, except =
you're just substituting the word 'heretic' with 'science'. and 'blasphemy'=
 with anything that disagrees with you.

There's an old
 saying:=C2=A0 "We =
become that which we hate".=C2=A0 So far, all you've done is denounce peopl=
e's efforts to try new methods and see what works.=C2=A0 You accept nothing=
 anyone else proposes if it does not agree with you.=C2=A0 That is the real=
m of the extreme skeptic: the same skeptic you ridicule.
=C2=A0
You certain=
ly don't have to agree with my comments.=C2=A0 And I don't have to agree wi=
th yours.=C2=A0 But no one needs all the name calling Frank.=C2=A0=C2=A0 It=
 really adds nothing to support your theories.

I don't think I have enough data yet to make any conclusions, so I pla=
n more experiments.=C2=A0 Since there are different distinct claims about w=
hat the box or the recorders can do, I try to make different distinct exper=
iments for each.

Some people claim they can get the box to tell them thing=
s that the operator couldn't know, so my "whats the object" experiment is o=
ne way to examine that.=C2=A0 Some people claim the boxes can make predicti=
ons, so cataloging predictions and examining the results can help examine t=
hat.=C2=A0 If there are other claims, I will try to figure experiments base=
d on those.

Here is a short file, where someone says, "Scamp, Scamp," then Scamp ba=
rks. "yap."=C2=A0 This little dog belonged to my grandma, when I was about =
9 or 10 years old, he was a Manchester Terrier, and lived with us for many =
years, and this is his bark for sure.=C2=A0 I'd know that bark anywhere.=C2=
=A0 Sorry, that I can't make it any clearer, I need to get one of those bet=
ter ghost boxes I guess.=C2=A0=C2=A0RJ, spirits are just like us, they are =
not omnipresent like God,=C2=A0=C2=A0probably why David doesn't want to pla=
y the guessing game, he has better things to do over there, and has said, t=
hey have thousands of people standing in this long line waiting to get into=
 the Heavens, and He can't just drop His job and go to your house to see wh=
at you have over there, He did tell me that first time what it was, and i s=
ent it to you, but it was too late.=C2=A0 It's hard for me to understand th=
em sometimes, He was also right about that little boy, Syler being
 killed,=
 and where his body would be found, I don't know what they did about it tho=
ugh. sf
